definition: to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: The Chinese show was magnificent. Our athletes were brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 中國的閉幕式非常恢宏壯觀，我們的運動員們也優秀。

sentences.english: Originally there was another parade of nations during the closing ceremonies of the Games.
sentences.chinese: 起初，在奧運會閉幕式上還有一次運動員遊行。

sentences.english: There will be a handing-over and taking-over ceremony in each closing ceremony of the Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 在這屆奧運會閉幕式上首次舉行了會旗的交接儀式，。

sentences.english: The closing ceremony is one big party.
sentences.chinese: 閉幕式也是一個大的盛會。

sentences.english: The competitors cantered into the arena to conclude the closing ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 選手們慢跑進入競技場，爲閉幕式畫上了句號。

sentences.english: You can watch it on TV.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在電視上觀看開幕式和閉幕式。

sentences.english: U.S. Labor Secretary Elaine Chao will now lead the U.S. delegation to the closing ceremonies.
sentences.chinese: 美國勞工部長趙小蘭現將率領美國代表團參加閉幕式。

sentences.english: Li Bin, director of the National Population and Family Planning Commission of China attended the closing ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 中國國家人口計生委主任李斌出席閉幕式。

sentences.english: Zhou Qiang, secretary of the CPC Hunan Provincial Committee, delivers a speech at the closing ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 中共湖南省委書記周強在閉幕式上發表講話。

sentences.english: Chinese actress Fan Bing Bing arrives for the closing ceremony of the 63rd Cannes film festival.
sentences.chinese: 中國女演員范冰冰到達的第63屆戛納電影節閉幕式。

sentences.english: The performers worked hard to prepare for the closing ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 爲了奧運會閉幕式，表演者進行了辛苦的排練。

sentences.english: Mei Kebao, vice secretary of the Hunan Provincial CPC Committee attended the closing ceremony and delivered a speech.
sentences.chinese: 湖南省委副書記梅克保出席閉幕式並講話。

sentences.english: The Chinese flag was raised, as the national 1)anthem rang out.
sentences.chinese: 隨着國歌響起，中國國旗在閉幕式上升起。

sentences.english: The Chairman YANG Ziyuan presenting prizes on the closing ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 楊資元執行會長在閉幕式上頒獎。

sentences.english: On the closing ceremony, 17 tons of fireworks were set off, 11 tons of which also came from that company.
sentences.chinese: 閉幕式燃放的17噸煙花中，11噸也來自該集團。

definition: the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
open ball (math.)/to start a ball game/to kick off (soccer)/to tee off (golf)
direct, winner-takes-all system of election in use for village committees/preselection for a competition
